rComments: He is a wonderful person- incredibly smart, experienced, and sincere. Don't take his classes if you want to mindlessly read a book and take an easy test. He expects his students to be insightful and actually care. If you don't (like most of these reviews) do yourself a favor and don't do it. I loved his class and took the time to learn a lot.
The biggest regret of my college career was choosing to take a class with Patton. Sure I got an A, but I learned nothing and the class was a pain to sit through.

I learned absolutely nothing from this class. It was a waste of my time & even thinking about having to sit in that room twice a week made me want to cry because it was so frustrating. He's extremely unclear & incompetent when it comes to teaching. I would never take him if you actually want to learn.

The worst teacher I've ever had. While yes his class is incredibly easy & he's a very sweet man. He has no idea how to teach a class effectively. If you actually care about the quality of your education, you'd be outraged that the faculty deems this person worthy of teaching at a university. His class was confusing, boring, & useless.

Great class, very straightforward. if you take good notes it will be a very easy A. The book is VERY important. You need to have it. There are a couple papers to write and he is very clear about what he puts on the test. Nice guy too.

This class was insanely easy. Patton was apparently living out some Dead Poets society fantasy. This means that he is not concerned with things like academic rigor;he let people essentially take the midterm twice. Take this class if you want a class that requires minimal

Gary Patton is one of the nicest people I have ever met. Fall 2013 was his first quarter teaching so there were some obvious course organizational issues. Besides that he is a very informed man, with actual practical legal experience (Environmental Lawyer), and really strives to engage students. I would recommend this course.

2013 was his first year teaching. He was okay. He didn't know how most things worked, he made the structure of the class up as he went, but he's a lawyer so he knows a lot! Very nice guy to talk to as well. I would recommend his class if Legal Studies is your major.
